results.title: After the glaciers
results.brief_description: Shows how much of the northern hemisphere surged back to abundant life during the periods of ice age retreat. Follows the pattern of plant succession, from lichens to mosses, to a forest.

results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Greg Reading and Film Australia

results.title: After the First
results.creator_credit: Karl Holtsnider, Teleketics and Nicholas Frangakis
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which explores a young boy’s emotions throughout his first hunting trip. Describes how the boy’s initial excitement, his mother’s concern and his father’s impatient pride all come together at the climactic moment of the killing. Designed to promote discussion on violence, fathers and sons, ecology, growing up and social conditioning. Designed to promote discussion on violence, fathers and sons, ecology, growing up and social conditioning.

results.title: After the axe
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ontario Regional Productions, Sturla Gunnarsson and Steve Lucas
results.brief_description: 250,000 managers get fired in North America annually. A cinematic drama drawn from real life examining executive terminations and a new industry specialising in handling them. The central figure, D.R. “Biff” Wilson, 44, is a composite figure based on extensive conversations with fired executives; the others play themselves. An interesting look at business ethics. (Awards: New York, Yorkton, Chicago, Oscar nomination)

results.title: After the 'ouch'
results.brief_description: After a series of small accidents, children apply first aid for a cut, splinter, bruise, nosebleed and minor burn. Also indicates correct response to a serious accident. Animation is used to show aspects of physiology. Suitab le for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: After Proust
results.creator_credit: Galadriel Films, Christopher McGill and John Baxter
results.brief_description: A fleeting encounter between a man and a woman is treated in a romantic fashion. Set in Edwardian Sydney, the film is intended to suggest the atmosphere of the period and the narrative style of Marcel Proust.

results.title: After prison, what?
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman, ONF | NFB and Ronald Weyman
results.brief_description: Portrays the difficulties experienced by a man who wants to go straight but is unable to get work because he has a prison record. Day after day Charles Brown answers the want ads but employers will not hire an ex-convict. Doubts and fears beset him - he is sincere in his desire to work at the trade he learned in the penitentiary and yet society will not trust him. Eventually, before he falls into his old ways, the John Howard Society secures a job for him where he can take his place in society and regain his self-respect. Film award: Canadian Film Awards.

results.title: After Mr. Sam
results.brief_description: A documentary record of a three-day conference held in Steinberg Limited’s lodge north of Montreal. Here, faced with the stepping down of Sam Steinberg as president, ambitious top-level executives thrash out their differences in matters of corporation policy and objectives, ever aware of the crucial issue: who will be president after Mr. Sam? Sprinkled with Sam Steinberg’s reminiscences and reflections on business, full of insights into the workings of a large corporation and clashes of interest and character, the film presents an unusually close view of a struggle for power and position.

results.title: After love = Apres l'armour [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Bernard Fetoux, Alexandre Films, TF1 Films productions, Prodeve and Diane Kurys
results.brief_description: Directed and written by Diane Kurys, “Apres l’amour” is the tale of Lola (Isabelle Huppert), a passionate woman caught between the two men in her life. Lola is a professional writer of independent means, living in Paris. Her long-term lover with whom she lives is David (Bernard Giraudeau), an architect. Marianne (Lio), his wife and mother of his two children, longs for him to return to the family home. David is still sexually active with Marianne and involved in their children’s lives. Lola meanwhile, is having an affair with a musician, Tom (Hippolyte Giradot), who is also married. Tom’s wife, Elisabeth, is aware of his extra-marital activities but is confident, as the mother of his children, of her power over him. Lola writes about her affairs with both men, pondering the meaning of her connection to them. Elisabeth and Marianne (the respective wives) are driven to despair by their husbands’ indiscretions. The film tracks a year in the life of the characters as they struggle to gain a sense of power over their relationships. “Apres l’amour” is a film about love, sex, marriage, commitment, parenthood and fidelity. Also starring Yvan Attal as David’s brother, Romain. In French with English subtitles.
